result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Issac Ali

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Issac Ali in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Issac Ali in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss but read in this case with case 14CF5695.  Court granted State's motion and ordered this case, both charges, dismissed but read in.
Defense counsel requested a brief adjournment.  Case is rescheduled for plea and sentencing before Branch 20 on 4/23/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Issac Ali not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel indicated that she needs an offer from Ms. Hammond on  15CF249.  Branch 20 in trial; new date set.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
ADA Frisch indicated he could assist ADA Hammond as he has lower--pending case, however, he is unavailable on 3/27/15 and requested another date.  Parties stipulate to 3/24/15 at 1:30 p.m. for plea.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Issac Ali not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Message left for ADA Hammond who contacted the court to obtain the next court date.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Issac Ali not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial; ADA unavailable when case was heard.  Case is adjourned for bail hearing and scheduling before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Issac Ali in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Issac Ali in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Isaac S. or Doriontae M.

Defendant Issac Ali in court with attorney Alexis Bianca Luster.  Defendant Issac Ali in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
